data.title: Baroness Lindsay Northover: Positions, Relations and Network
data.meta_description: Director/Board Member at Pensana Plc, Discover Baroness Lindsay Northover's known position history, network and 98 relationships. Find out about his known public assets.
data.text:
Miscellaneous Commercial ServicesCommercial Services

Royal African Society amplifies African voices and interests in academia, business, politics, the arts, and education. The non-profit company is based in London, UK. The British company's network reaches over a million people.

Investment Trusts/Mutual FundsMiscellaneous

The United Kingdom Committee for UNICEF Ltd. is an organization dedicated to improving the lives of children worldwide. The non-profit company is based in London, UK. The British company's mission is to build a better world for every child, and they achieve this through various means such as donations, fundraising, and campaigning. The company was founded in 1946. Jon Sparkes has been the CEO of the company since 2022.

Financial ConglomeratesFinance

AgDevCo Ltd. identifies, develops and arranges financing for sustainable agricultural and agri-processing business opportunities in Africa. It also funds the development of agriculture-supporting infrastructure such as irrigation, feeder roads and bulk storage. The firm invests patient capital in the form of debt and equity into early stage agribusinesses and act as promoter or co-promoter of greenfield agriculture opportunities. It operates with locally managed subsidiaries in Mozambique, Ghana, Zambia, Malawi and Tanzania. The company was founded by Keith Palmer in 2009 and is headquartered in London, the United Kingdom.

Medical/Nursing ServicesHealth Services

Malaria Consortium is a non-profit organization that specializes in preventing, controlling, and treating malaria and other communicable diseases among vulnerable populations. The non-profit company is based in London, UK. Malaria Consortium's evidence-based programs combat targeted diseases and promote universal health coverage in Africa and Asia. The British company was founded in 2003 by Sylvia Meek, and the CEO is Charles Nelson.
